question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: verify()] [Vector cloning] Does the collect::<Vec<G1Projective>>() at line 221 cause memory exhaustion with large encryption key sets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Unbounded growth] Can repeated aggregation cause soks vector to grow unboundedly, leading to memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Struct: Transcript] [Large vector allocation] Can an attacker force allocation of extremely large V and C vectors by manipulating sc.n? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: aggregate_with()] [Concurrent modification] If aggregation occurs while verification is running, can race conditions cause verification failures? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: maul_signature()] [Concurrent mauling] Can concurrent calls to maul_signature() corrupt the soks vector? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: deal()] [Zero threshold] Does the function handle sc.t = 0 correctly, or can it create degenerate transcripts? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: deal()] [Single player] Can dealing with sc.n = 1 cause division by zero or other edge case failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: verify()] [Empty transcript] What happens if all vectors (V, C, soks) are empty? Does verification fail gracefully? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: verify()] [Threshold equals n] Can sc.t = sc.n break the low degree test or polynomial interpolation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: verify()] [Rogue key attack] Can a malicious player contribute a rogue public key in aggregation that cancels out honest players' contributions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: verify()] [Pairing cancellation] Can carefully chosen group elements cause the pairing check at line 236 to pass through unintended cancellations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/unweighted_protocol.rs] [Function: deal()] [Weak secret] Can dealing a secret with low entropy or known structure weaken the security of the distributed key? (High)
